hyp_text: Civilization is the shared culture of a large group of people who live and work together (i.e. a society).
prompt:

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.

src_text: 「文明」(civilization) 一詞源於拉丁文 civilis（意為民事），它與拉丁文 civis（意為公民）和 civitas（意為城市或城邦）相關，那在某程度上亦界定了社會的規模。
ref_text: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
hyp_text: The word "civilization" derives from the Latin civilis, meaning "of or pertaining to citizens," which in turn derives from the Latin civis, meaning "citizen," and civitas, meaning "city" or "city-state," which in turn defines society's scale in some degree.

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
